pros: Very friendly and peaceful place to work
cons: Nothing really bad to say here

pros: Insurance, bricks, squirrels, food pantry for students.
cons: Needs an equity audit of salaries. Will end up losing best people due to this. No way to increase wages except for COLAs. No negotiation of starting salary in many cases.

review_title: Good Job, great training, be PATIENT
pros: Excellent training, Good communication, up to date education. Maintains a healthy work to life environment.
cons: Not a place to slack. Office politics, and bureaucracy keeps an desire for growth within the departments nominal.

review_title: Under appreciated, under valued, and overworked.
pros: Good benefit packages for a family with kids.
cons: Staff are constantly overworked, over-used, under-appreciated, and under valued. There is a saying, "it's Eastern", which implies the crappy administration.

pros: Great place to grow and level up. The new President is on a rockstar. A modern day Ted Lasso. She has the whole campus fired up and ready todo their best.
cons: Campus culture needs to improve

pros: Great work environment Great exposure Works around schedules
cons: Overworked Not enough compensation Stressful at time

review_title: Great job if you can get it
pros: Academic freedom affords the ability to work on antyhing that interests you.
cons: Students are as burned out as faculty. Administration is a revolving door of clowns.

pros: Good quality people that were above average in competence and their ability to focus on the here and now as well as macro level issues in office or on campus. Tolerant of most viewpoints but they have clear preferences. Events and community involvement also excellent. Willingness to work with people of any background to help if they are patient.
cons: Generally left leaning and progressive politically which can make life difficult sometimes, but this is the case with almost all Universities. Pay and turnover are not great but acceptable.

pros: Great coworkers, hands on with students
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: The majority of departments seem to collaborate well together.
cons: Simply the uncertainty of higher academia is making the university system more of a business than a place of education; not all students who are attending the university are truly ready for the rigors associated with a university setting. Admin urges the sentiments that the "customer is always right" rather than acknowledging that some students ought to not delve directly into being full-time.

job_title: Food Service Aide 1 in Cheney, WA
pros: Part-Time low-stress job, not a lot of responsibility
cons: Other employees and some bad managers

review_title: It is what you make it
pros: Certain periods where employees have a lot of free time, which can be helpful for self-care and/or self-development.
cons: Not much room for clear upward mobility although some have been promoted.

review_title: Work study at Eastern Washington University
pros: Good pay, and work schedule for students
cons: not many work hours available during academic year

pros: Flexible, great coworkers, great way to get first hand experience
cons: Low Pay and can be stressful

pros: Love this job it was great
cons: none, I loved my job here

job_title: Student Success Advisor in Cheney, WA
pros: You get a 1 hour lunch break.
cons: Low salary for the education level they require. They want candidates to have a minimum of a graduate degree and pay less than 50k.

pros: Students are great. Most of the staff is warm and friendly. Warm and supportive environment for students
cons: Pay is ok. Poor management of money and resources.

review_title: No leaders, No strategic planning, it is going to sink.
pros: Good benefits, beautiful campus, easy to commute
cons: Current leaders do not care about students but themselves and their career advancement.

review_title: Mostly flexible with school and work balance
pros: As a student, I was able to have a flexible schedule when working.
cons: At times there was too much work for me to handle.

pros: Some good co-workers. Eager to share info and help out

pros: I loved working here. It was a positive addition to my college experience.
cons: I have no cons to my experience.

pros: Flexible academic schedule with holidays off
cons: No support or voice is given to non-TT faculty.

pros: Very professional atmosphere, everyone was very helpful and nice.

pros: Family based, every one friendly

job_title: Applications Development Intern in Cheney, WA
pros: it was a good job for working as a student
cons: it feel very much like an internship

review_title: Not the best, but can be steady-ish
pros: Employment can be relatively steady.  Free parking if you are willing to walk.  No one hits you.  Paychecks come on time, usually.
cons: Everyone looks tired, students included.  Basically a commuter school, and most students have families and outside jobs...often big families and tough outside jobs. Expectations for part-time faculty are excessive considering the salary, working conditions, and, especially, the almost total lack of potential for advancement.  Generally no work available during the summer.  Faculty work really hard, for zero recognition.  Administration seems completely out of touch with day-to-day operations.  Horrible morale at this place.  Getting to classrooms in winter can involve walking through icy fields to distant buildings, where you teach in a coat closet.

review_title: Ok at first, got old quick
job_title: Food Service Worker Lead Float in Cheney, WA
pros: Decent pay, often left alone to supervise closing shift, free food
cons: Got moved to different locations without any choice, treated poorly, often unprofessionally, constantly reminded that we are disposable and tools to advance profit. No consistent scheduling, schedules moved around to control people not for any reason in particular. Treated like children and often spoken down to, supervisors blowing small things out of proportion to look like they were doing something, when they mostly sat around and left early. Unrealistic expectations. Upper management acted as if they were royalty to be exalted. Most held only high school deplomas and their lack of intelligence often showed. For most this was the pinnacle of their lives and achievement. Power tripping hard.

pros: Great group of staff and faculty (generally). Students are wonderful. EWU has a great core to it and a great campus.
cons: The University is plagued with poor leadership and horrid management that ignores all input. It has been a parade of inept administrators that are rotated in and out of positions - the worst administrators are kept in place to do the maximum amount of damage to morale. Pay is horrible and there is no incentive for doing a good job as there are no raises once you are hired.

pros:
Reasonable working hours
Good public transport
A few enjoyable coworkers
Tuition discount
(Pro/Con) Overtime is relatively rare (read: no budget)
cons:
Extremely poor morale due to secretive and hostile management
High work load with consistently around 10% of OIT positions unfilled
Employees with net negative productivity
Wages below market rate
Management has no cohesive plan, but is quick to shoot down new ideas

review_title: Not a place to actually make a change
pros: I've met some of the best people in my previous positions at this institution. The benefits are pretty great, if you actually get through the 6-month probationary period.
cons:
The politics of universities are absolutely horrendous! The higher up you work, the more hierarchy you meet, even in departments that were created to dismantle that sort of thing.
In order to do anything, you have to know people. And if you know the right people, one might even get a job they are unqualified for. Ultimately this created a hostile working environment because that person had no experience leading a team. They kept changing the job description to suit their own wants and needs.

review_title: Good environment with opportunities to excel.
pros:
- friendly coworkers
- low student-to-faculty ratio
- lost cost of living area (Spokane, WA)
- small university with very diverse population
- great place to live if you like the outdoors
- modern tech in most/all classrooms
cons:
- buildings often in process of being remodeled
- not the most... brilliant student body (low bar for acceptance)
- office space, though provided, not always beautiful

pros:
Very reasonable working hours.
Vacation + Sick time + 10 state holidays.
Take 10 credits per quarter for $5.
Free public transportation.
Hands on interaction with many different applications, technologies, and tools.
Work face-to-face with faculty, students, and administrative staff.
Collective Bargaining with WFSE.
State benefits with pension and 403B retirement options
Work with intelligent, well–intentioned people.
cons:
State compensation levels.
Goals, plans, and successes need to be more transparent.
Union resists many modernization moves causing:
 1) Long waits for changes
 2) A communication rift between management and staff on many strategic initiatives
EWU has many important players with differing goals, it can become political.

pros: EWU paid for me to get my Masters. The work environment was great and my boss was very understanding about my school work. I really felt that they wanted me to succeed in my degree and they helped in every way possible. Between the school paying for most of my tuition and paying me a salary, I was able to live comfortably renting an apartment in Cheney.
cons: There can be a lot of distractions. Between students stopping by and employees having non-work related conversations with you, a good pair of headphones can help keep you focused.

pros: Resigning before it got really bad.
cons: No direction.  Favoritism.  Employees targeted for speaking out.  Vengeful management practices.  No promotion opportunities -- unless you suck up.

job_title: Academic and Student Activities Advisor in Cheney, WA
pros: Family feel. It feels like a small town on campus and people seem to really care about your wellbeing. Faculty and staff really care about the students and their success. At the end of the day, you feel great about what you do for a living when you work at Eastern.
cons: It's as bureaucratic as any other university. You have to accept that things move slowly and that communication lines are often crossed.

pros:
Eastern Washington University encouraged me to start something big
"                                               " was conducive for learning
cons:
Administrative red tape interrupted fluency
Large facility that required room changes for equipment usage

pros: Eastern Wasington University has a relaxed environment, nice people to work with, non challenging work site, and comes with washington state employee benefits.
cons: Operates like a third world country, disfunctional leadership, incompetent managers, unchallenging work environment, unable to understand basic business principles, and very nepotistic.

job_title: Computer Science Lab Tutor in Cheney, WA
pros: I was a Computer Science Lab Tutor. It was easy and you got to help people, though most of the time it was just how to use Microsoft Office products. The people are easy going and nothing that should stress you out too much.
cons: Not very challenging and sometimes boring. Had to report time online then print it out, get it signed and turn it in again, kind of redundant. Minimum wage but that's expected.

pros: I loved teaching there, but I think that one's experience is largely due to what department one is in.  Our department had a commitment to high standards not necessarily shared by the administrative office.  I loved the students, as they became very open to professors that had a lot to offer.
cons: Depending on the department, one could spend a lot of times in intra-department squabbles.

job_title: Depart Office Aide in Cheney, WA
pros: A mostly open schedule that encourages multitasking if you're an attending student. There is plenty of time to focus on academic while earning a paycheck.
cons: The actual job is not a steady stream of activity. There are peak days in which you're incredibly busy and days where nothing happens.

job_title: Student Event Tech in Cheney, WA
pros: Great working for students around the campus. Always good to see something new.
cons: University management is always a mess. there is no room to try something different and everyone has their own vision for each department

job_title: Both Classified and Exempt in Cheney, WA
pros: Quiet town and nice campus
cons: Not many options for advancement, though this is true of state jobs in general. A cloud of negativity hangs over all staff positions. This is an extremely political environment with leadership that is substandard and unconcerned.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Cheney, WA
pros: Get a nice office, feel like a peer with your faculty, get access to most rooms, get to help students, enjoyed it a lot!
cons: Have to deal with student conflict from time to time, if you don't teach than it's fairly random what you do, ... not much else.

pros: Faculty, staff, and students are, for the most part, and amazing group to work with. Great benefits and vacation.
cons: Policies around academic advising staff does not honor work/life balance. Too many higher ups are trying to micro mange their staff, and it has created a toxic work environment for advisers.

job_title: IT Operations Assistant in Cheney, WA
pros:
Good experience for future job in IT
Flexible with class schedule
Set my own schedule
Got to know the EWU campus well
cons:
Internal Politics
No performance reviews
Poorly planned stressful projects
Unclear expectations
Sometimes not enough work for all the students hired

pros: Great benefits, flexibility in schedule
cons: There is a huge difference in workplace culture from department to department in addition to the to there is a huge different in workplace culture from department to department. My personal experience was that there was a lack of accountability, and few opportunities for personal career development

review_title: Got my foot in the door
pros: Chance to apply major.  Reinforces fundamentals.  They give you an office to be shared with one other student. Flexible hours.
cons: Grading is dull. Sometimes the supervisor was slow to correct errors.  After a couple quarters the 100 level labs become repetitive to teach.

review_title: EWU has been ok place to work. Has it's ups and downs over time.
pros: Working at EWU has been a great career building experience. I've gotten to learn more on the job that I would have predicted.
cons: The political climate can be a showstopper on getting anything accomplished. Extremely slow at implementing anything and often frustrating.

job_title: Career Advisor in East Brunswick, NJ
pros: Great work family!  Supportive when it comes to taking on new projects and professional development.  Idea driven.
cons: Does not make step increases so whatever salary you start with you stay at. This requires you to job switch to advance in pay so experience migrates and people job hop.

pros: The hourly pay was good and the people were nice. Staff writers in the Online Department weren't overburdened with work.
cons: I was 'let go' because of our company's dwindling funds. Also, student employees aren't given the same legal rights as regular employees.

review_title: EWU is a great employer with fantastic teams
pros: Full medical, dental, retirement, transit benefits, excellent union communication, universal  team mentality, sense of community, responsive HR department, excellent education benefit.
cons: Little career movement for staff, little corrective action for abusive workplace environments, state pay, performance reviews do not result in reward in compensation

job_title: IT Professional Assistant in Cheney, WA
pros: There are many great mentors in IT and even more great clients to work for. If you are willing to work, it is great job security.
cons: Bureaucracy sometimes gets in the way of giving our clients the best service. Amount of work is either overwhelming or underwhelming and rarely steady.

pros: I have found that the vast majority of staff and faculty are really passionate about working here. It makes collaboration amazing.
cons: It can be frustrating to get things done in such a structured hierarchy, including getting things throu HR and other administrative departments.

review_title: UREC staff at Eastern Washington University
pros: All co-workers are college students which makes the job enjoyable and the workload is low for the hourly wage given.
cons: Very difficult to find a jobs after graduation.  This is based more so on the location then the experiences learned on the job.

job_title: Computer Lab Consultant in Lawrenceville, NJ
pros: Lots of diversity to learn new software, design, printing techniques, and problem solving skills. Also our boss understands school comes first, is not a micro-manager, and very kind & reasonable manager.
cons: Minimum wage and not a lot of opportunities to move up.

job_title: Grad Assistant in Copperas Cove, TX
pros: EWU paid for me to get my Masters Degree while I worked as a grad assistant. My boss always worked with my class schedule and was very flexible. Couldn't ask for a better place to work.
cons: I really can't think of any cons.

pros: Work with students and always are their to help. Office culture was professional and semi strict.
cons: Really didn't experience any that point out in general.

job_title: TAW Office Worker in Cheney, WA
pros: Easy to get a job.  Good schedule.
cons: No respect.  Boss is bipolar. Low wage.  Random deadline changes.  No privacy. Uncomfortable work environment.  No training.  You will not advance in your position. 11 month working schedule.  Corrupt management.

pros: Amazing people to work with.  Many are so helpful in building you up and offering you opportunities. Working directly with students was very fulfilling and challenging.
cons: Certain individuals can make and break an organization or department.

pros: State job, good benefits and decent pay.
cons: Very political environment, ideas are valued less than connections.  It should be easier to remove ineffective and inappropriate leaders.

pros: This is a low stress environment where you get to work with other students
cons: Your hours depend on how many students decide they actually want a tutor
